title_en: The trade union of the Popular Front of Ecuador holds protests against Noboa and the IMF
summary_en:
The Popular Front of Ecuador held a protest against the government and economic policies of President Daniel Noboa.
The demonstration was presented as a warning due to the proposed abolition of subsidies on gasoline prices.
The protesters burned a cardboard figure of President Noboa and carried posters criticizing the ruler and the national political class.
The President of the Popular Front assured that the protests had been repeated in several regions of the country and would continue in other provinces and cities.
Trade unions have ruled out the possibility of dialogue with the government to reach agreements on social compensation and economic measures.
The President of the National Union of Educators expressed regret over the government's announcement of the abolition of gasoline subsidies in the midst of the economic crisis.
Work centers and public organizations are preparing new protest actions for the first days of July.
The cancellation of subsidies can cause a serious social reaction and is part of the fees that are usually set by the International Monetary Fund.

title_en: The Minister of Education met with the leadership of Fecode to reach agreements
summary_en:
Education Minister Aurora Vergara opposes teacher evaluation based on Sabre 11 and PISA tests.
The Colombian Federation of Educational Workers (Fecode) is holding a strike, expressing dissatisfaction with the legislative law.
The Minister is holding a meeting with Fecode to reach consensus and preserve the statutory law.
It is necessary to revise about eight articles of the law to improve its formulation and adoption.
Fecode is working against the education bill, considering it inconsistent with the agreements and distorting the recognition of the basic right to education.
The teachers' union notes that the consensus minimizes the struggle that has been waged for more than 42 years since the time of the Pedagogical Movement.
Fecode expresses disagreement with the creation of bureaucratic apparatus for investigation, monitoring and control.
The draft statutory law on education is considered neoliberal and regressive, aimed at stigmatizing and hitting the Federation, teachers and educational communities.

title_en: Argentine Senate approves Milea's star reform
summary_en:
The Argentine Senate has approved the Law on the Basics, the reform of President Javier Miley.
The voting ended with a minimal difference, the vice president of the country was responsible for the tie-break.
The legislation includes controversial labor reform and the privatization of state-owned enterprises.
The day was marked by the dispersal of demonstrators in front of the Congress, as a result of which people were detained and injured.
The President of Argentina called the approval of the Law on Foundations a historic and triumph of the Argentine people.
The bill gives Miley extraordinary powers and includes financial cuts, privatization and layoffs of employees.

title: –£—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è Fecode: "–ú—ã –∏–¥–µ–º –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ –ö–æ–Ω–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∞, –∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞‚Äù
title_en: Fecode Teachers: "We are going against Congress, not against the government‚Äù
summary_en:
Thousands of people are mobilizing against education reform in Colombia.
Colombia's main trade union, Fecode, is protesting against changes to the education bill.
Fecode believes that the changes have distorted the essence of the bill and contribute to the commercialization of the sector.
Teachers express dissatisfaction with the Minister of Education and believe that the changes were possible thanks to her approval.
The protesters criticize various aspects of education reform, including evaluating teachers on student performance.
The last-minute changes have disappointed teachers and reduced protection of their interests.
Some teachers do not agree with the call for the complete curtailment of the project and hope for continued reform.

title_en: Barcelona taxi drivers announce a 12-hour strike next Tuesday
summary_en:
Barcelona taxi drivers announced a 12-hour strike on Tuesday.
The sector will stop working from 6:00 to 18:00.
Drivers complain about the "abuses" of insurers and ask the Spanish government to intervene.
They also require "decent" fares from the Metropolitan Taxi Institute.
Drivers are warned about "quarantine" at cruise terminals, the airport and the Sants railway station.
Elite Taxi, Anget, STAC, ATC and Pa are involved in the protest.
Taxi drivers demand the intervention of the Ministry of Transport in the actions of insurers.
The City Council is asking for a permanent police presence at Sants Station.

title: –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ—Å–æ—é–∑—ã –ø—Ä–∏–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç –∫ —Å–∞–Ω–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–Ω–æ–π –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–µ –≤ –ê–Ω–¥–∞–ª—É—Å–∏–∏ 26 –∏—é–Ω—è
title_en: Trade unions call for a sanitary strike in Andalusia on June 26
summary_en:
Trade unions are calling for a sanitary strike in Andalusia on June 26.
The strike is being held in protest against the dismissal of 5,000 specialists and the lack of negotiating capacity.
The problems of the Junta of Andalusia are related to overcrowded waiting lists, the collapse of the primary health care system and staff cuts.
Four unions announced a partial shutdown of all SAS centers and services from 8 a.m. to 11 a.m.
Trade unions condemn the non-compliance with the agreement in the field of primary health care and the dismissal of staff.
Downsizing is one of the main reasons for supporting the strike.
The lack of forecasting and a clear policy became the reasons for the strike.
The Council on the pact in the field of primary health care was signed just over a year ago, but the supervisory board met only once.
The Ministry of Health is struggling with reducing the waiting lists for surgical intervention of patients.

title_en: Labor: a warning strike by port workers in Emden on Friday
summary_en:
The Verdi trade union has called on workers at the Emden seaport to declare a precautionary strike on Friday morning.
The strike is scheduled to begin at 6:00 a.m. and last until noon.
This is the fourth such action within the framework of this round of tariffs.
The employers, the Central Association of German Port Companies (ZDS), have not yet submitted proposals for discussion.
The second round of negotiations will take place on June 6, but June did not lead to a result.
The next round of negotiations is scheduled for June 17 and 18.
Verdi demands an increase in hourly wages by three euros from June 1 and a corresponding increase in shift allowances.
ZDS understood this, but did not take it into account sufficiently in its proposal.
It is necessary to reduce the wage gap between different groups.

title_en: The unions are calling for an SAS strike on June 26 to "fulfill what has already been signed."
summary_en:
The Working Commissions, UGT, SATSE and CSIF have announced a call for a partial shutdown of the Andalusian Health Service.
Non-fulfillment of agreements, layoffs of employees and suspension of the work of the Labor Exchange are the reasons for the strike.
This is a "historic" strike, which was agreed to by "four majority unions representing 80% of the sector."
The mobilization began due to the delay in the implementation of the agreement on primary health care.
Three lists of people who have not been given a professional career are under consideration.
The suspension of the work of the labor exchange causes problems, since contracts were not concluded on time.
The unions have asked to talk to the one who makes political decisions to solve the problems.
